repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Fixes https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/3174

I've removed all assignment of `is_self_arg` out of the parser, since it can be overridden in too many ways so I don't think it's usefully done there. It's possible that the tests will show I've missed something important where its used (in which case I can undo the change)

I took the tests from @navytux's https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3175/ (thanks!), so this PR will supercede that one

comment_data.body: Can we keep the `if` test? Given the default class attributes, it doesn't seem necessary to always set it (and that avoids an unnecessary attribute in the instance dicts).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -901,8 +901,7 @@ def hdr_cname(self):
 
 
     def analyse(self, env, nonempty=0, is_self_arg=False):
-        if is_self_arg:
-            self.base_type.is_self_arg = self.is_self_arg = True
+        self.base_type.is_self_arg = self.is_self_arg = is_self_arg

comment_data.body:
Whenever we touch such code, it's a good time to clean it up along the way.
```suggestion
def p_c_base_type(s, nonempty=False, templates=None):
```
Note that you need to change `Parsing.pxd` as well (we should have a test job that exercises the `--cython-compile-more` build option – would also be interesting to see if it makes a performance dfference).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2477,13 +2477,11 @@ def p_positional_and_keyword_args(s, end_sy_set, templates = None):
         s.next()
     return positional_args, keyword_args
 
-def p_c_base_type(s, self_flag = 0, nonempty = 0, templates = None):
-    # If self_flag is true, this is the base type for the
-    # self argument of a C method of an extension type.
+def p_c_base_type(s, nonempty = 0, templates = None):

@@ -2477,13 +2477,11 @@ def p_positional_and_keyword_args(s, end_sy_set, templates = None):
         s.next()
     return positional_args, keyword_args
 
-def p_c_base_type(s, self_flag = 0, nonempty = 0, templates = None):
-    # If self_flag is true, this is the base type for the
-    # self argument of a C method of an extension type.
+def p_c_base_type(s, nonempty = 0, templates = None):
     if s.sy == '(':
         return p_c_complex_base_type(s, templates = templates)
     else:
-        return p_c_simple_base_type(s, self_flag, nonempty = nonempty, templates = templates)
+        return p_c_simple_base_type(s, nonempty = nonempty, templates = templates)

@@ -2527,8 +2525,7 @@ def p_c_complex_base_type(s, templates = None):
     return type_node
 
 
-def p_c_simple_base_type(s, self_flag, nonempty, templates = None):
-    #print "p_c_simple_base_type: self_flag =", self_flag, nonempty
+def p_c_simple_base_type(s, nonempty, templates = None):

@@ -3052,7 +3049,7 @@ def p_c_arg_decl(s, ctx, in_pyfunc, cmethod_flag = 0, nonempty = 0,
             complex = 0, longness = 0,
             is_self_arg = cmethod_flag, templates = None)
     else:
-        base_type = p_c_base_type(s, cmethod_flag, nonempty = nonempty)
+        base_type = p_c_base_type(s, nonempty = nonempty)

comment_data.body: I'm working on adding CI jobs. Seems we've piled up some more differences in the past already.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2477,13 +2477,11 @@ def p_positional_and_keyword_args(s, end_sy_set, templates = None):
         s.next()
     return positional_args, keyword_args
 
-def p_c_base_type(s, self_flag = 0, nonempty = 0, templates = None):
-    # If self_flag is true, this is the base type for the
-    # self argument of a C method of an extension type.
+def p_c_base_type(s, nonempty = 0, templates = None):

commit.message:
tests: Demonstrate failure of @staticmethod with implicit `object` argument type

See https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/3174.
If I remove `# doctest: +SKIP`, the test fails as:

    FAIL: call_static_pxd_cdef_with_implicit_object (line 102) (static_methods.__test__)
    Doctest: static_methods.__test__.call_static_pxd_cdef_with_implicit_object (line 102)
    ----------------------------------------------------------------------
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/doctest.py", line 2224, in runTest
        raise self.failureException(self.format_failure(new.getvalue()))
    AssertionError: Failed doctest test for static_methods.__test__.call_static_pxd_cdef_with_implicit_object (line 102)
      File "/home/kirr/src/tools/py/cython/TEST_TMP/run/c/static_methods/static_methods.so", line unknown line number, in call_static_pxd_cdef_with_implicit_object (line 102)

    ----------------------------------------------------------------------
    File "/home/kirr/src/tools/py/cython/TEST_TMP/run/c/static_methods/static_methods.so", line ?, in static_methods.__test__.call_static_pxd_cdef_with_implicit_object (line 102)
    Failed example:
        call_static_pxd_cdef_with_implicit_object(2)
    Exception raised:
        Traceback (most recent call last):
          File "/usr/lib/python2.7/doctest.py", line 1315, in __run
            compileflags, 1) in test.globs
          File "<doctest static_methods.__test__.call_static_pxd_cdef_with_implicit_object (line 102)[0]>", line 1, in <module>
            call_static_pxd_cdef_with_implicit_object(2)
          File "tests/run/static_methods.pyx", line 108, in static_methods.call_static_pxd_cdef_with_implicit_object
            return FromPxd.static_cdef_with_implicit_object(x)
        TypeError: Cannot convert int to static_methods.FromPxd

/cc @robertwb

Fix type of self argument from staticmethod in pxd

I've removed all identification of is_self_arg from the parser,
since I think it's better dealt with when analysing the declaration.
It's possible that this was too thorough and will cause problems
(in which case I've undo it)

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Fix type of self argument in cdef staticmethod declared in a pxd file
